title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 18 March 2015 - XWiki
content:

09:54 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <msmeria> has quit  
09:59 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:03 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <tmortagne> has quit  
10:09 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: Hi  
10:23 <gdelhumeau> hi tmortagne  
10:23 <tmortagne> would be great if you could check if your XE packaging refactoring in XE-1475 fixed XWIKI-11892  
10:23 <tmortagne> this can of issue is usually a document order issue  
10:24 <tmortagne> that's the only non assigned blocker left for 7.0RC1  
10:26 <gdelhumeau> I've never installed oracle  
10:26 <gdelhumeau> is there a free version somewhere?  
10:27 <tmortagne> no idea, msmeria could help but I don't see him connected  
10:28 <tmortagne> vmassol: any idea  
10:28 <tmortagne> ?  
10:28 <vmassol> otp  
10:28 <tmortagne> I know you debugged some oracle stuff in the past  
10:31 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <Enygma`> [ANN] Starting the 6.4.3 release...  
11:19 <vmassol> gdelhumeau:  
11:20 <vmassol> yes there is  
11:20 <gdelhumeau> I'm installing in on a windows vm  
11:20 <vmassol> I've even documented it at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationOracle#HInstallingOraclefromaVM  
11:20 <vmassol> :)  
11:21 <vmassol> (reboot my mac)  
11:25 <vmassol> has quit  
11:29 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:14 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
12:27 <cjd> has quit  
12:41 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
12:49 <mflorea> Enygma` it's dangerous to update translations when releasing a bug fixing version.  
12:52 <Enygma`> mflorea: "When you release a .x version (bug fix release), be very careful when  you update translations because the new ones might concern new stuff  introduced in the master branch. The issue is that the translations wiki  does not support branches." is all we have in the documentation  
12:52 <Enygma`> if we want to say "don`t update translation for bugfix releases", then we should do so :)  
12:53 <Enygma`> hope everything will be ok :/  
12:53 <Enygma`> right now I`m having problems with license headers in rendering  
12:54 <mflorea> yes  
12:54 <lucaa> has quit  
12:54 <Enygma`> mflorea: I know you`ve fixed something similar for commons recently  
12:54 <Enygma`> any pointers?  
12:55 <mflorea> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/403292ab7bd54ce1aa6a2e2ee8c5f96d350f42a6  
12:55 <mflorea> I didn't merge it on 6.4.x (because I didn't had the need :P )  
12:56 <Enygma`> ok, cherry-picking it then  
12:56 <Enygma`> thanks  
12:56 <mflorea> shouldn't be hard to change l10n to add the license header, to please vmassol  
12:56 <mflorea> I'll have a look when I find some time  
13:13 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
13:30 <lucaa> has quit  
14:09 <vmassol> mflorea: the valid reason shouldn't be to please me :) but because we have to have license headers in all files we dsistribute  
14:09 <vmassol> \*distribute  
14:09 <mflorea> vmassol: sure ;)  
14:10 <mflorea> that's why I plan to look at it  
14:10 <vmassol> ok thanks!  
14:10 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
14:12 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: do you know if we have some doc to configure an external solr server on xwiki.org?  
14:23 <vmassol> I've found http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Solr+Search+API#HConfiguration  
14:23 <tmortagne> vmassol: I don't think we have any doc to install a standalone SOLR server, only the XWIki part  
14:23 <tmortagne> but Solr has documentation  
14:24 <tmortagne> you can also look at solr.xwiki.org or solr.myxwiki.org for inspiration (they don't do the same thing)  
14:24 <vmassol> cool didn't even know we had solr.xwiki.org )  
14:24 <vmassol> :p)  
14:24 <tmortagne> when you download solr package you get a pre configured jetty instance  
14:25 <vmassol> I'm just documenting it  
14:25 <vmassol> ok  
14:25 <tmortagne> it's indicated in http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Migrations  
14:26 <tmortagne> but solr.xwiki.org reuse xinit, if you want to see the solr jetty instance use you can look at solr.myxwiki.org  
14:26 <tmortagne> note that since solr 5 they provide debian package as far as I understood  
14:27 <tmortagne> (and they used to provide debian package before 4.x)  
14:29 <vmassol> tmortagne: could you check what I added at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances#HStandaloneSolr to see if it's correct?  
14:29 <tmortagne> on it  
14:29 <vmassol> thanks  
14:30 <tmortagne> "you can check their UI here and here." not really  
14:30 <vmassol> admin ui?  
14:30 <tmortagne> you see them because you are allowed to  
14:30 <vmassol> oh ok  
14:30 <vmassol> :)  
14:30 <vmassol> so let me remove this sentence  
14:30 <vmassol> done, thanks  
14:36 <lucaa> has quit  
14:50 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:15 <cjd> has quit  
15:20 <vmassol> thanks evalica for the update :)  
15:21 <evalica> vmassol: np - thanks for providing the updated nodes :)  
15:30 <msmeria> has quit  
15:32 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:35 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:35 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: the recent change you did for overriding skin files fails on Windows  
15:36 <gdelhumeau> Hi Enygma`  
15:36 <gdelhumeau> thanks for noticing it  
15:36 <gdelhumeau> I'm gonna fix it  
15:36 <Enygma`> Manuel just left, so I can`t really paste you the exception, but it`s related to WikiSKinUtils.getSkinResourceFromDocumentSkin  
15:36 <Enygma`> something with subdirectories in the flamingo skin  
15:37 <Enygma`> a path like "/flaming\bootstrap" as far as I remember  
15:37 <Enygma`> probably needs cleaning  
15:37 <Enygma`> should be fixed before we go ahead with 7.0RC1  
15:38 <Enygma`> works fine on linux, so CI did not catch it  
15:38 <Enygma`> credit goes to Manuel though :)  
15:39 <Enygma`> think it was more like: "/flamingo/less\bootstrap"  
15:43 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: I`ve reopened XWIKI-11803 for better visibility. Please make sure to close it when you manage to fix it.  
15:45 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
15:58 <tmortagne> vmassol: the servlet upgrade probably deserve a note in Backward Compatibility section in the release note  
15:59 <vmassol> tmortagne: you mean that older servlet container won't work anymore?  
15:59 <tmortagne> yes  
15:59 <vmassol> yes indeed  
15:59 <tmortagne> for upgrade for examples  
15:59 <vmassol> I thought I put something but not in that section, checking  
15:59 <tmortagne> and I would probably put it in its own section instead of Miscellaneous since it's an important change  
16:01 <tmortagne> (talking about New and Noteworthy part)  
16:03 <vmassol> tmortagne: moved here: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki70RC1#HIssuesspecifictoXWiki7.0RC1 Not sure if we need that in New and noteworthy, it's not really the goal of that section  
16:03 <tmortagne> you moved too much, fixing  
16:03 <vmassol> sorry  
16:04 <vmassol> I'm in a meeting at the same time… not very focused :)  
16:08 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
16:15 <Enygma`> 6.4.3 build is done  
16:15 <vmassol> :)  
16:34 <gsmeria> has quit  
16:37 <Bugen\_do> has joined #xwiki  
17:17 <gdelhumeau> Enygma`: fixed  
17:17 <Enygma`> cool!

18:09 <gdelhumeau> java.sql.SQLException: Cannot create PoolableConnectionFactory (ORA-01017: invalid username/password; logon denied  
18:10 <gdelhumeau> but of couse I have created the user with the good password, etc
